kernfrasen: Jesus the Son of God reigns over all things
sat down at the right hand of the Majesty on high
Lord of the rulers and political movements
The rulers of the earth belong to God
songs of resistance, songs of defiance

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: Jesus the Son of God reigns over all things... sat down at the right hand of the Majesty.

cognitieve_implicaties: The universe is not chaotic but governed.
theologische_implicaties: Christology is inherently political; Jesus' authority supersedes Caesar/State.
ethische_implicaties: Allegiance to God takes precedence over nationalistic loyalty.
onbedoelde_consequenties: God as a distant, bureaucratic monarch.

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: The preacher revitalizes the 'King' metaphor by mapping it onto the specific, contemporary political shift in South Africa (Mandela's inauguration).

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The preacher successfully bridges the 'vertical' metaphor of Ascension (up/high) with the 'horizontal' reality of political history (Pretoria).

incoherentie_punten.locatie: Introduction of Rwanda vs South Africa
incoherentie_punten.conflict_beschrijving: If God is King over all the earth, the presence of 'Hell' in Rwanda creates a logical tension regarding the extent of that reign.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: The train (a physical container/path) becomes a 'vehicle of historic exultation,' blending the struggle of the journey with the joy of the destination.

sterktes.beschrijving: De-literalizes the 'levitation' aspect of Ascension to focus on the 'authority' aspect.
sterktes.voorbeeld: The meaning of Ascension Day is not that Jesus went up into the clouds as though a puppeteer on high had jerked a string.

risicos.beschrijving: Risk of equating a specific political victory (Mandela) too closely with the Kingdom of God.
risicos.voorbeeld: God planned the whole thing for the feast of the Ascension.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregation may view political setbacks as God's defeat.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: Linked to the tangible end of Apartheid.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Strongly aligns with the 'King' imagery of the Ascension liturgy.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by the JURIDICAL and POLITICAL domains, which is appropriate for Ascension. It avoids the 'dead' imagery of clouds and levitation by grounding the 'Highness' of Christ in the 'Highness' of a balcony in Cape Town. The transition from the macro-political to the micro-personal is handled through the metaphor of 'fighting demons.'

revitalisatie_suggesties.huidige_status: Often viewed as a 'faintly comical' physical event.
revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Use the 'Rainbow' vapor trails of the jets as a living metaphor for the 'glory' of the ascended Lord.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: The planes streamed clouds of vapor in rainbow colors... the kingdom of this world has become the kingdom of our Lord.

coherentie_verbeteringen.incoherentie: The 'Devils in Rwanda' vs 'God is King' tension.
coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Explicitly address the 'Already/Not Yet' tension of the Kingdom to explain why the King allows 'devils' to remain active.

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: God as merely a social facilitator rather than a holy judge.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Balance with the 'feared' aspect of Psalm 47 mentioned earlier.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To describe the 'building' of a new society as a reflection of the 'New Jerusalem'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in using CMT to bridge the gap between ancient liturgy and contemporary history.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: An aesthetic analysis would focus on the beauty of the 'rainbow' imagery; CMT focuses on how that imagery maps the concept of 'Glory' onto 'State Power'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Kolb would look at the learning styles (experience/reflection); CMT looks at the underlying cognitive structures (Source/Target).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: CMT reveals that the preacher is using 'Joy' as a 'Weapon' (Military Domain), which explains why the laughter of Tutu is described as 'powerful'.

appendices.notities: Sermon delivered in a high-church context (Grace Church, NYC) but uses very 'low' or 'earthly' source domains to explain 'high' theology.
